title: Custom Domain Name in Localhost Ubuntu 22.04
snippet: This documentation lets you run your php projects via apache2 using your own own custom local domain name instead of running it via localhost.Creating a Directory For Your ProjectChange directory to your www foldercd /var/wwwMake directory folder for your project inside the www directorysudo mkdir yourprojectnameCreating Vhost file for your projectGo to the sites-available directory inside apache 2cd /etc/apache2/sites-availableCreate your config file inside the sites-available directorysudo touch yourprojectname.confEdit the config filesudo gedit yourprojectname.confPaste the following (use your desired domain name) then save and close:<VirtualHost *:80>	ServerName yourprojectname.dev	ServerAdmin webmaster@yourprojectname.dev	DocumentRoot /var/www/yourprojectname	ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/yourprojectname-error.log	CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/yourprojectname-access.log combined</VirtualHost>Link Apache2 Available Sites directory to Enabled Sitessudo ln -s /etc/apache2/sites-available/yourprojectname.conf /etc/apache2/sites-enabled/yourprojectname.conf Reload Apache 2sudo service apache2 reloadEdit linux hosts file then include your custom domainsudo gedit /etc/hosts127.0.0.1	localhost127.0.1.1	vuelguevara-ROG-Zephyrus-G14127.0.1.1	yourprojectname.dev# The following lines are desirable for IPv6 capable hosts::1 ip6-localhost ip6-loopbackfe00::0 ip6-localnetff00::0 ip6-mcastprefixff02::1 ip6-allnodesff02::2 ip6-allrouters
